Package TheGame

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Card
    Card is defined in a fairly self explanatory way: - Must have rank (ie.
    CardHolder  
    CuarentaGame
    The game itself consists of two players (human and computer), a deck of cards, and a table for holding played cards.
    Deck
    The Deck should work as follows: -It contains 40 Cards: - 1-7, jack, queen, king of each suit -It contains a function that deals one card randomly - the same card should not be dealt multiple times - the deck can ONLY deal the 40 cards it possesses -Shuffling of the deck returns again all 40 cards
    Discardpile
    The discardpile consists of nothing for now, I already once refactored it away once, but then decided that it might be of some use when figuring out what to show in the graphics part of the game (ie.
    Hand
    For now, it is simply a 'CardHolder' earlier I was thinking of creating additional properties for it, but if those don't work out, I'll just refactor it away.
    Logic
    The game is played as follows: Win condition: 40 point -Rounds are played until win condition is reached Round: 1) 5 cards are dealt to both players from the shuffled deck 2) Play the round - As in most games, the player not 'dealing' goes first - Dealers is swapped every round - After cards are played, count points, check win condition 3) Repeat 1&2 until deck is no more NOTE: If one player gets to 38 points, special rules come into play 4) If no one win, deal new round.
    Player
    The player must have the followin properties: - Name (because why not...
    RandomNumbers
    I've been always told to not trust the Language's own random number generator so I'll probably find that code for a mersenne twister I have running around somewhere.
    Table
    Table is a 'CardHolder' that knows which card was last played.
